description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3gcfe","text":"This protocol describes the selective enrichment of Salmonella from surface water samples AFTER  non-selective enrichment from several different recovery methods (Modified Standard Method 9260.B2, Vertical Modified Moore Swab, or Dead-end Ultra-filtration (DEUF).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":52,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Salmonella isolation, surface water, Selective Enrichment
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"66ps6","text":"Supplies Needed","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ap3jc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5vk5o","text":"Tetrathionate broth (TT, Acumedia #7740), Prepare this as close to day of use as possible","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"11unc","text":"Rappaport-Vassiliadis Salmonella enrichment broth (RV, Acumedia #7730)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":22,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9ka05","text":"Gram-negative Hajna broth (GN, Acumedia #7218)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fulr","text":"Brilliant Green Sulfa agar (BGS, Acumedia #7299)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57irv","text":"XLT4 agar (Acumedia #7517)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a2shr","text":"XLT4 supplement (Accumedia # 7990) - Sodium tetradecyl sulfate (Tergitol 4)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eig10","text":"Sterile culture tubes","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: This protocol has been used with a control strain at four different USDA ARS laboratories and has been able to selectively isolate Salmonella from non-selective media when the level of Salmonella in water ca. 0.030 CFU/mL.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"evmqr","text":"Dispense   GN (Gram-negative Hajna broth) into sterile test tubes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqhc0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9","error":false,"guid":"6B1528F0CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afatq","text":"Hand massage UPB(Universal Pre-enrichment Broth)-enriched modified Moore swab (MMS), BPW (Buffered Peptone Water)-enriched filter cakes (47 mm glass filters),  or shake BPW-enriched bulk water or 2X BPW-enriched backflush (from DEUF filtration) to homogenize before transfers to Salmonella-selective media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":279,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blgfu","text":"Aseptically transfer   of either UPB or BPW enrichments into selective broths and then incubate at specified temperature listed in Table 1. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":21,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"n9pl","text":"      Broth  Volume (mL)  Enriched UPB/BPW to add (mL)  Incubation Time and Temperature    TT Broth  9  1  48 h @ 37°C    GN Broth  9  1  24 h @ 37°C  ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":151}],"data":{}},{"key":"97rhs","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9t8si","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"70D2BBE0CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","0_3":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","1_3":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","2_3":"","A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"C_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"D_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["","","",""],"colWidths":["66.99715805053711","93.99715805053711","195.98958587646484","221.98958587646484"],"data":[["Broth","Volume (mL)","Enriched UPB/BPW to add (mL)","Incubation Time and Temperature"],["TT Broth","9","1","48 h @ 37°C"],["GN Broth","9","1","24 h @ 37°C"]],"guid":"82B2FB73CC3211ECA02B0A58A9FEAC02","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":8,"offset":0,"style":"bold"},{"length":10,"offset":63,"style":"italic"}],"key":"4koei","text":"Table 1. Selective broth volumes and incubation parameters for Salmonella isolation.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Broth","Volume (mL)","Enriched UPB/BPW to add (mL)","Incubation Time and Temperature"],["TT Broth","9","1","48 h @ 37°C"],["GN Broth","9","1","24 h @ 37°C"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"81t4o","text":"Transfer   of 24 h GN broth enrichment into   RV (Rappaport-Vassiliadis) broth.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":44,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e2am3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"7C125F60CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9.9","error":false,"guid":"86446370CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"am1n","text":"Transfer   of 48 h TT broth enrichment into   RV broth.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":44,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"466p9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"96759750CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9.9","error":false,"guid":"9B925660CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f9ngq","text":"For the GN/RV enrichment, vortex tubes and use a sterile 10 µL loop to streak for isolation onto both XLT4 (Xylose Lysine Tergitol 4) (prepared with Sodium tetradecyl sulfate, XLT4 supplement) and BGS (Brilliant Green Sulfa) agar plates.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fine7","text":"Incubate XLT4 and BGS plates at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"70bis","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B8C61370CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"BAD7DC70CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lni2","text":"For the TT/RV enrichment, vortex tubes and use a sterile 10 µL loop to streak for isolation onto both XLT4 and BGS plates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2qd1","text":"Incubate XLT4 and BGS plates at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":32,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cfeaa","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"C2D96BF0CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"C45ED370CC3311EC92F6B790BE17B8D0","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2gncu","text":"Inspect XLT4/BGS plates from Day 3 (GN/TT) for presumptive Salmonella colonies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":59,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ag8sk","text":"Inspect BGS and XLT4 plates from TT/RV enrichment and identify presumptive Salmonella colonies (see above).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":75,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"737nr","text":"Colonies from both Day 4 and 5 can be subjected to further confirmation using triple sugar iron (TSI) agar, lysine iron agar (LIA), and/or PCR (see following sections).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a9t6f","text":"If non-fluorescent presumptive Salmonella isolates are observed, these isolates can be isolated and preserved (frozen stocks) for further characterization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":31,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmtim","text":"From the XLT4 plates, select presumptive environmental Salmonella colonies (black raised center, clear halo) and streak onto fresh XLT4 plates.  Salmonella colonies on BGS appear opaque and surrounded by red color on all edges.
